intro: Waluewa pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful waluewa, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Waluewa pulchella is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
